intro: Erysimum sylvestre subsp. sylvestre, commonly known as the wild wallflower, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and slightly hairy. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in early spring. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in woodland edges and rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
